item.title: Running local proxies
item.description:
As I’ve mentioned a couple of times recently1 2, I have set a handful of different things on my local machines to make remote development a bit easier. This time around, I have two more to add to that list:

  • Setting up a local SOCKS proxy with SSH
  • Setting up a local TOR proxy for testing / more anonymous browsing
  • Configuring your browser to use these proxies for some/all traffic

In both cases, I have these running on an always-on server that I use for various projects just like this. It could just as easily be set up to run on a Raspberry Pi or on your local machine.

item.title: Using a Microsoft keyboard with a Mac
item.description: I use a MacBook at work. It’s nice, since it’s Unix’y enough that I can work in the terminal yet works much better out of the box than Linux. On the downside, the keyboard is less than great for carpal tunnel syndrome. So instead, I’ve been using a Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboard. Then though, you have the difference between Control/Windows/Alt keys and Control/Option/Command.

item.title: Firefox vs Chrome
item.description: Deciding which browser to use has been a bit of a challenge for me.
